activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher D Robarge

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM Defendant Christopher D Robarge in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Christopher D Robarge.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Formal reading of information waived. Not guilty pleas.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:15 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher D Robarge in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Christopher D Robarge. 
Formal reading of complaint waived. Preliminary Hearing Waived. Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial. Arraignment set.
Arraignment scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher D Robarge appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Christopher D Robarge for today only.  Address and phone number confirmed.  Bond set.  Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney today before leaving the Justice Center.   AIA set for Friday.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
